item.title: ChanoMa
item.description: Overview ChanoMa (means “Living Room”) is a service for a dual-income households with a children whose age is under 9 years old to tighten family bonds. Special features of this service is the following: Play with children when parents are busy because working mother’s life is terrible Record and share children’s daily responses because parents don’t understand children well This is a client work for C-EP (Chubu Electric Power), which supplies electricity to 10 million households in Japan.
